results.title: Dumbo. Father Noah's ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.
results.brief_description: One of Disney’s most endearing animated films. Dumbo is the story of a baby circus animal born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all the other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse. After Dumbo is involved in several disastrous performances under the big top, Timothy decides to launch Dumbo as a new star - the world’s only flying elephant. Also included in this program are three Disney cartoons: “Father Noah’s ark”, “The Practical pig”, and “Three orphan kittens”.
results.title_for_label: Dumbo. Father Noah’s ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.

results.title: Dues and the union
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Morten Parker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The importance of the regular payment of union dues and how they keep a union going is told through the story of a young pipefitter. New to the trade and to his responsibilities as a union member, Frank Weston found there was much to learn about both. Fortunately for him, his boss on the job - a skilled tradesman and a founder of the union - had the patience to teach him. Through him Frank learns the significance of prompt dues payment and the services provided by them, and comes to enjoy the satisfaction of active and interested union membership.

results.title: Dudu and the line
results.creator_credit: Steve French and Second Banana Films
results.brief_description: Explores the magic and fun of animation through Dudu, an ordinary little chap who encounters an extraordinary line which obeys nothing but the animator’s imagination. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Duck hunter's dilemma
results.creator_credit: Minnesota Museum of Natural History and University of Minnesota
results.brief_description: Shows the nature and extent of present waterfowl problems in America. Illustrates how game biologists are carrying out field experiments on bird habits and how the results and conclusions of this research are being put to practical use in the preservation and fostering of the waterfowl population.

results.title: Duane Hanson
results.brief_description: American sculptor Duane Hanson is a major figure in the neo-realist movement. He casts real people in plastic moulds and uses the painted cast, dressed and lifelike figures to make social and political comments which can be disturbing.

results.title: Drylanders
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The epic story of the opening of the Canadian West, and the drought that brought depression in the Thirties. The story begins in 1907 with homesteaders staking life and future on the promise of unproved land. Harassed by winter cold and blazing heat of summer, they learned to farm land where moisture was uncertain. Some found the loneliness and the risk too great and gave up. This family tells of a family who stayed. Cast includes: Frances Hyland, James Douglas and Lester Nixon. Narrated by William Weintraub.

results.title: Drying
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Preservign and Drying of Plant Material”.
One of three films dealing with different aspects of preserving and drying of plant material, showing the techniques and everyday domestic equipment needed to achieve satisfactory results. This film deals with preservation by drying.

results.title: Dry pastures and flood plains
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: As well as the difficulties encountered in selling Australia’s surplus of dairy products over our domestic needs, dairy farmers face extremes of climate conditions - lack of adequate regular rainfall, flooding, poor soil, etc. Examines ways of overcoming these difficulties via research into pasture improvement and its application and the introduction of new and improved farming machinery and equipment.

results.title: Drums for a holiday
results.creator_credit: A R Taylor, Peter Stiles and Anglo-Scottish Pictures
results.brief_description: This film looks at the Gold Coast (now Ghana), its history, industries and export trade in cotton and cocoa, and social and political life. Half of the world’s cocoa comes from this region, and the harvesting, fermenting, drying, grading according to quality, and selling and shipping of the beans is illustrated. The film records a ceremonial parade to the local Durbar attended by the King of Ashanti, village Chiefs, and British representatives. Commentary by Leo Genn; photography by Stanley Gooze and edited by John Ferris
